BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION FOR MINOR CHILD TO CONTINUE COUNSELING
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, and filed this Motion for Minor Child to Continue Counseling and would state
as follows:
1. The minor child, namely, A.K.M.,dob, 05/24/2012, has been seeing a counselor
named Deidre Leslie at CAC (Children’s Advocacy Center) for approximately three
(3) years;
2. That due to funding, Deidre Leslie’s counseling services were eliminated and she is
now with Prevail Counseling and Wellness;
3. That due to the fact the minor child is under the age of 14, a new consent form must
be signed by both parents;
4. That as of this date, the Mother has not signed as she wants a counselor they both
agree on;
5. That A.K.M. has established a relationship with Deidre Leslie and is very comfortable
talking with her;
6. That the Father feels to change counselors at this point would be starting over for the
minor child and feels that this might not be the best choice for the child’s mental
health well being;
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Father requests this Court order the Mother to sign
the consent form that she has been sent in order for the minor child to continue her counseling sessions
with Deidre Leslie.
DOCUMENT 400
Respectfully submitted on this the 30th day of October, 2025.
